title: Gary Vee is a Wee Bit Cringe

comments.comment: Gary Vee is like when you didn’t read the book and then had to do a report in front of the class.
He feels like Michael Scott from the office when he's trying to look knowledgeable.
Gary is the type of guy that'll say you're completely wrong and then proceed to repeat everything you've said with synonyms and act like it's his idea
Gary's got a unique skill in the sense he's able to convince middle school entrepreneurs to take a shit in a gas station sink by telling them its the next 'big play'
Gary Vee is the kind of guy who talks for 1 hour about the fact that he doesn’t have 9-12 minutes
This guy is a great example of "Say ANYTHING with enough confidence and some people will believe it."
Gary Vee is the master of talking without actually saying anything.
Gary Vee feels like the most condescending guy in the world despite not having any knowledge or wisdom
“If you can’t dazzle them with brilliance, baffle them with bullshit” - he‘s living that quote
"I don't know what he does but he speaks alot" this is the most accurate description of gary vee.

Gary V: I don't eat breakfast

Gary V: I eat breakfast 6 times a day.
Gary Vee is like if Ben Shapiro tried being the Wolf of Wallstreet but for NFTs

Pewds ultimate wisdom/truth: "Everyone who made money did it in a different way"
Doesn't mean it'll work for everyone

“You can’t sell the formula because it’s different for everyone” -pewds
Very well said
All I could think of looking at the thumbnail was "Put in the work, put in the hours, and take what's ours!"
He isn’t joking. He failed at school and was fortunate his father gave him a good start. People from money all end up into these gurus. I agree with pewds.
This guy’s philosophy is just “confuse them, that’ll convince them”
Pewds is on point by being honest about timing and luck being a factor in sucess; thats the type of important knowledge you never hear from the "gurus".

"there's no better advice than... advice from a-a rich guy... right?"

Ken's slow realisation of the irony of what he's saying, as he's saying it, is golden.

So glad i started watching PewDiePie again. Seriously, I used to work with people who are followers of Gary V. And for like 1-2 years I forgot what normal sounds like. I felt like being gaslighted and told that my normal is not normal. My mental health took a hit not gonna lie. This video is a splash of cold water. Thank you @pewdiepie.

Hahaaa this is great!!!! My husband has watched Gary vee from time to time and I’m so glad this video exists so I can laugh at it . I’m sure he’s done well for himself and helped others but he’s just too intense for me. To each their own

Cinnamontoastken: "I don't even like Cinnamon Toast Crunch."

Me: "My disappointment is immeasurable, and my day is ruined."
That guy is living proof that if you have money and speak with confidence, ppl will believe anything you say.

Gary: "Breakfast is a conspiracy created so people buy cereal."

Also Gary: "Here's 3 of my favourite cereals. I don't eat them for breakfast tho."
Gary's entire persona is someone going on a rant when the Adderall kicks in
If he doesnt have the time to throw out his gum, he probably doesn’t have the time to wipe after pooping…
The conclusion is, he just says common things that people already know but different kind of pitch and delivery.
I love how Pewds and Ken have remained friends for all these years. This is a true friendship people. The chemistry they have with each other is immense.

Guru’s be like “Your thoughts become reality.”
This guy: “Imagine your family being shot in the face.” Repeats it twice.

I’m so glad that Gary is finally being taken to task for his BS by multiple big YouTubers. I have railed against this guy for years and as a former employee I can’t tell you how toxic and dysfunctional his company is. The culture is an oil/water mix of burnt out, cynical people who see this charlatan for what he is… and mindless sheep cult followers who hang on every word he says.

"Passive Income doesn't exist"
Damn good to know that Jeff Bezos makes money as he sleeps not because of passive income but because he is on that sleep grind

I kind of feel bad for Gary. I cannot stop but think that all he needs is somebody to hug him and tell him its alright and he doesn't need to try so hard proofing his worth to the world. Then again he prosthelytizing for his super unhealthy mindset and pushes his vulnerable followers into the same self-destructive behavior he uses to cope with whatever problem he has. Just because you have certain issues to work through does not mean you can just project them onto everybody else.
As an aspiring entrepreneur, I’m glad that Felix is calling people like this out. It’s exactly as he said. You can’t sell the formula because everyone who’s successful did it in a different way.

i was on a week Gary Vee high one time and here are some points:
- he brought his father's wine business online and grew it exponentially (impressive yes but it was already big to begin with)
- he pride himself in being an early adapter marketer and keep  referencing that he made a google ad campaign the first day it was available
- he works mainly in marketing? and says that he works with big names but I don't really know whats notable in his portfolio 
- as pewds said, I stopped watching when I realized he can talk so much with saying so little. he has some good advice don't get me wrong but he talks like every end of a phrase should be a mic drop when he didn't really say anything special
"There's no better advice than advice from a rich guy": this is why I watch PewDiePie

How to be rich

1. Start business
2. Make profits
3. Be rich

“Who in my family, pick one.”
“All of them”
Man, this guy being too specific chill man.
If Gary Vee ever finessed me at my garage sale I’d be ok with it.

Gary has been manipulating the markets for several years, has a group of billionaire investors and all buy/sell at the same time. He is under investigation by the S.E.C and A.M.F! He uses his fame to raise his projects and immediately sells his shares, the majority of his projects never come to life. One of the most hated entrepreneurs in the industry, except for those who don't really know him. Gary is simply a great talker and an excellent manipulator.
Fun fact: the kid that asked for YouTube advice is now at 330k, kinda wholesome

"Turn Netflix off" has the same energy as the fitness trainer dude who overheard 16 yo me talking about my gaming hobby to my own trainer and felt the need to yell at me about how it's a waste of time and will make me fat and just isn't healthy.

Well joke's on you Jeremy, I run 8 miles almost every day AND game hard. It's almost like I can have more than one hobby/interest.

"He looks like he's 20 and 50 at the same time"
Ken kinda described himself ngl
This guy’s advice is the equivalent of: “If you get shot, dont go the doctors. Your body has healing abilities. Going there is just a waste of time and money”

I see gary vee's advice as like salt,  just a sprinkle of it could work wonders for certain people and certain situations, but with him its like unscrewed the top of the salt shaker and poured it directly in your mouth
I can't believe people listen to that guy. He doesn't say anything.
This kind of content, where he shares his philosophies (especially on trending items), is top tier content IMO.
I love how every person that loved Midnight Mass agrees that the “dialogue”, (or monologues) about death was hilariously long and aimless.
It's literally impossible to not eat breakfast, unless you're starving yourself. The first meal that you eat in a day inevitably becomes breakfast, because that's you "breaking your fast".

What I noticed about Gary Vee, he gives the greatest non answers ever. If you really listen to what he’s saying .. he just dances around your question. I do this when I lie to my parents .. crazy how that skill could potentially make me a millionaire
5:13 very bold of you pewds to assume Gary V wipes at all. You know he can’t afford to waste that precious time doing a meaningless task of getting the shit out of his ass.
after many years of being bullied into consuming gary's content by my millenial brother, I finally have this to confront him with. very cool, Felix. very cool. :))

Finally someone actually talked about how cringe this guy is. I kept getting youtube recommendation about how this guy is such a "savage" motivational speaker and I just find him screams "how do you do fella kids" vibe.  I don't know how there's quite a lot of people actually looked up to him.
Gary is like that guy who watched wolf of wall street and now wants to do "business".

I like how Pewds acknowledges that starting out on YouTube now is WAY different than when he started.  I just generally like how he doesn't pretend that his success is from anything special he did.  (He's basically saying, "It's harder now because there's so much content and competition," without really saying that)

You could have named it 
"Gary is a VEE bit cringe"
You had it right there!!
Gary vee is the type of guy to look for the cheapest item at the dollar store

I'm a periodic viewer, so forgive me if I'm "way behind" or whatever, but I absolutely love this duo!! You two have great chemistry and the videos I've watched with you both are really enjoyable and funny to watch.
"If you can't convince them, confuse them."

Can I just point out that both Ken and Pewds are such wholesome guys. Watching them makes me feel so chill and at home.

Ken: the advice he was giving wasn't completely horrible, not to get caught up in the system

"Random bullshit go!!"

Gary Vee took that too literally.

I think the thing I dislike most about Gary Vee is that he loves to tell his audience their wrong publicly. They could be spouting something he said verbatim in a previous conference and he would tell them "see this is why you won't ever make it." Like Jesus dude someone else can have a good idea you're not God.
just a wee bit? i’d say gary vee is two shakes away from a cringe overload
At this point we need a podcast series with Pewdiepie, Ken and other special guests..

13:00 I have a good analogy for that
In a speedrun just focusing on the main story might seem like the fastest route but in actuality doing a side misson to unlock a special weapon or ability might be the difference between a dead run and a world record.
"Don't listen to Gary Vee." Sun Tzu, The Art of War
“Picture someone in your family was shot in the head” definitely sounded motivational in his head

Gary Vee: "I poop standing up because taking the time to sit down is inefficient."

Audience : "Do you take the time to flush afterwards at least?"

Gary Vee: "I don't go out of my way to go to the toilet in the first place. I'm way too busy for that."

Audience: "What's that smell..."
He is the perfect example of talking loud and in a serious tone and you can talk all kinds of non-sense and people will listen to you
Alternate title: "this is what casually swallowing chewing gum does to a person"
Gary is right about a lot of things. Gary is wrong about a lot of things. The real problem is trying to figure out which is which
0:43 - Dude, that editing is so f'n good. That killed me.

The: „Just work for ten years, don't buy anything or have fun, and you'll become rich.“ is toxic and wrong on so many levels. 
1.) It's a lovely recipe for emotional, psychological and physical burn-out, would love to see a person in that state, unable to function in any way whatsoever, get rich. 
2.) Like Felix stated, just working hard doesn't guarantee you you will become rich. 
3.) If you save up and don't have fun for ten years, do you think that once (if) you get rich, you suddenly won't have this mindset of: "I need to save up and I can't have fun"? You guessed it. 
4.) Is it really worth it to suffer for ten years just to become rich and then (maybe) enjoy life? How long do you think just the money itself will keep you content/happy? 
5.) What if you can't find a job or your job isn't making you too much money all these years, then what? 
His solution isn't a formula, it's just a terrible advice that's said so quickly that you barely have any time to question/analyse it, and so confidently (arrogantly, in my opinion) that it "just must be true". Man, just listening to this guy is so draining, and I feel sorry for his followers - getting brain-washed by his toxic advice and conspiracy theories...
Gary Vee should write a book named; how to say absolutely nothing by talking too much.
